conclusion: Analyze the state change of the ideal gas using the p-V diagram.
The p-V diagram shows a state change from A to C with a horizontal line from A to B and a vertical line from B to C.
Identify the process as isobaric from A to B and isochoric from B to C.
Calculate work done for stage 1 (A to B) using W = p × ΔV.
ΔV is calculated as 3 × 10^-3 m^3 from the diagram.
Work done for stage 2 (B to C) is zero since ΔV = 0.
Calculate total work done as p × 3 × 10^-3 m^3.
Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Since the process is adiabatic (Q = 0), ΔU = -W.
Solve for p using ΔU = 200 J, resulting in p = -66666.67 Pa.
Use the ideal gas law: pV = nRT.
Calculate the number of moles (n) as approximately 1.35 × 10^-3 mol.
Use ΔU = nC_V ΔT to calculate temperature at state C.
Solve for T_C, resulting in T_C ≈ 283 K.
